content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-006-02-A |Item_parent=The organisation of clinical practice and the methods used to secure the patient's care pathway |Item_parent_short=The organisation of clinical practice and the methods which make it possible to secure the patient pathway |Rank=A |Item_parent_short=The organisation of clinical practice and methods for securing the patient's care pathway |Description=Knowing the main systems |Rubric=Definition |Contributors=Virginie Migeot |Order=2}} There are different methods of working in multi-professional teams in outpatient and inpatient settings: - A multi-professional protocol - Multidisciplinary consultation meetings (RCP) - The checklist in the operating theatre or for so-called "interventional" activities (endoscopy, interventional radiology, central venous catheters, chemotherapy, etc.). - Mortality and morbidity review (RMM)

question.question: What is the primary purpose of a multidisciplinary consultation meeting (RCP)?
question.option_a: To review patient outcomes and identify areas for improvement in care pathways
question.option_b: To develop and implement new treatment protocols for complex cases
question.option_c: To provide education and training for healthcare professionals on new technologies and procedures
question.option_d: To facilitate communication and collaboration among healthcare teams to improve patient care
